comments:
Build ID: 3.2.1 and 3.3 M4

Steps To Reproduce:
1) Open Window->Preferences->Java->Installed JREs pref page.
2) Select any existing JDK -> "Edit"
3) Select any existing system library (important)
4) Now click on "Add external Jars"
5) Select any new jar you like, then confirm selection
6) Nothing happens, but in the log you see nice CCE

The error didn't occur if you skip step 3.


More information:
java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.LibraryStandin cannot be cast to org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.LibraryContentProvider$SubElement
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.LibraryContentProvider.add(LibraryContentProvider.java:231)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.VMLibraryBlock.add(VMLibraryBlock.java:366)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.VMLibraryBlock.widgetSelected(VMLibraryBlock.java:320)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:928)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3348)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2968)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:820)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:796)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.InstalledJREsBlock.editVM(InstalledJREsBlock.java:613)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.InstalledJREsBlock.access$700(InstalledJREsBlock.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.jres.InstalledJREsBlock$9.handleEvent(InstalledJREsBlock.java:337)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.EventTable.sendEvent(EventTable.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.sendEvent(Widget.java:928)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.runDeferredEvents(Display.java:3348)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:2968)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.runEventLoop(Window.java:820)
	at org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.open(Window.java:796)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.OpenPreferencesAction.run(OpenPreferencesAction.java:65)

fixed in HEAD, there was a typo in an instanceof statement which would bypass the correct type to cast the element to and cause the CCE.

see LibraryContentProvider#add(...)
